conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into the containers E, F, or G.
The baffles are designed to redirect the flow of liquid in specific directions.
Baffle A is on the top left and points downward.
Baffle B is on the top center and points downward.
Baffle C is on the top right and points downward.
Baffle D is on the far right and points downward.
Since all the baffles are pointing downward, the liquid will flow downward through the baffles.
The liquid will then enter the containers below the baffles.
Container E is on the far left.
Container F is in the middle.
Container G is on the far right.
The liquid from A will flow into container E.
The liquid from B will flow into container F.
The liquid from C will flow into container F.
The liquid from D will flow into container G.
The final answer is: A flows into E, B flows into F, C flows into F, and D flows into G.
